channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerous trees overhanging our property, 23rd October
item.description:
There are two dangerously listing trees overhanging my property.Bromley Council worked on two trees in this area over the summer but these trees were untouched. Limbs have fallen in the recent strong winds and I am concerned the whole trees may come down as both are listing badly. If this was to happen they would hit my property and cause serious damage and possible injury.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highgrove Close, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large pool of dirty smelly water across road and footpath nxt lamppost, 23rd October
item.description:
Enormous pool of dirty smelling water full of organic matter, not draining, now eroding footpath, being sprayed over pedestrians by every vehicle that drives through it. This needs to be drained and surface water managed in someway so that it does not put Road users at risk, especially pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downs Bridge Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to property due to lack of drainage, 23rd October
item.description:
Due to lack of road drainage for approx 200m on Logs Hill in heavy rain it becomes a virtual river with nowhere for the rainwater to go. This has caused damage to our driveway as sometimes the water comes up to 1m into our driveway. The rainwater has taken way our driveway material numerous times so now it is pointless us in replacing. The flow has been so bad it has created several holes in the driveway that are increasing with every heavy rainfall.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Logs Hill, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown weeds in the power substation grounds on duncroft road., 23rd October
item.description:
I live at 48 Eastview Avenue and the rear of my property backs onto the power substation on duncroft road. At the rear of my garden I have a garage that has started to get damaged by weed infiltration from the substation grounds. Their are climbing weeds climbing up the rear of the garage that I am unable to remove as they are on the grounds of the substation. The climbing weeds are already up to the full height of the roof of the garage and without removal are likely to start growing onto the garage roof.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastview Avenue, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle parked in a resident payable zone., 23rd October
item.description:
The vehicle has been present in this location for months now. There are 4 bays for people that have a permit and I pay a yearly fee to park here. Spaces are low and when bays are full I have no parking space what I actually pay for.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Richmond Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Knocked down wooden fence, 23rd October
item.description:
Please can this issue be rectified as this has not been actioned since August. The fence is even more broken than it was before, the metal fence has clearly not worked to resolve the problem. There is rubbish dumped there and people accessing it at night. There are real concerns for safety as there are random people accessing the back garden of properties located on Blean Grove from there. Those gardens back onto the desolate area which has had a broken fence now since June 25. Please can this matter be urgently addressed properly so that the fence prevents people accessing it. It is a really sore sight and a real issue which is next to the residential properties and very close to a playground/school facility.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avington Grove, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
